intro: Landolphia corticata, commonly known as the African star apple, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a fleshy, star-shaped fruit that is edible and has a sweet, acidic flavor. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is valued not only for its taste but also for its medicinal properties.
